channel.title: Microsoft Encarta on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Who Killed The Encyclopedia?
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: The CD-ROM was sold to the public and the world as a way to bring interactive multimedia experiences into our homes. (Certainly, that’s how the magazine world tried to sell it.) But beyond that, it was a sheer amount of storage for a price that was insane to consider at the time. And that meant that some of the earliest products produced for the CD-ROM format were of the reference variety.
